description: All planned work items across assignees and types. Backlog items, upcoming tasks, and work queue. Essential for sprint planning and workload management.
Active work items across all assignees and types. Current development, ongoing tasks, and work in flight. Critical for daily standups and progress tracking.
Completed work items across all assignees and types. Finished tasks, delivered features, and resolved issues. Important for velocity tracking and delivery metrics.
All bug reports across statuses and assignees. Defects, issues, and quality problems. Essential for quality tracking and bug triage.
User stories across all statuses and assignees. Feature requirements, user needs, and functionality development. Critical for feature tracking and delivery.
General tasks across all statuses and assignees. Work items, action items, and miscellaneous activities. Important for project organization and task management.
Epic progress across all statuses and assignees. Large initiatives, feature sets, and strategic work. Essential for roadmap tracking and milestone management.
High priority items across all statuses and assignees. Important work, urgent tasks, and priority deliverables. Critical for resource allocation and escalation.
Critical priority items across all statuses and types. Emergency work, blocking issues, and highest priority tasks. Essential for incident response and urgent action.
Low priority backlog items across all assignees. Nice-to-have features, future improvements, and optional work. Important for backlog grooming and capacity planning.
Unassigned work items across all statuses and types. Orphaned tasks, backlog items needing owners, and resource allocation opportunities. Critical for workload distribution.
Items under review across all assignees and types. Code reviews, design reviews, and approval processes. Essential for quality gates and workflow management.
High priority bugs across all statuses. Critical defects, important fixes, and urgent quality issues. Essential for bug triage and quality management.
Open bugs across all assignees. Unresolved defects, active issues, and quality concerns. Important for bug tracking and resolution planning.
Blocked work items across all assignees and types. Dependencies, impediments, and workflow bottlenecks. Critical for removing obstacles and maintaining velocity.
Resolved bugs across all assignees. Fixed defects, completed bug work, and quality improvements. Important for tracking bug resolution and testing queue.
Items with release versions across all statuses and types. Release planning, version tracking, and delivery scope. Essential for release management and planning.
Completed items by release version across all types. Delivered features, release scope completion, and version tracking. Critical for release notes and delivery confirmation.
Open bugs by reporter across all reporters. Bug reporting patterns, user feedback, and issue sources. Important for understanding quality trends and user experience.
Items created today across all statuses and types. New work, fresh issues, and daily activity. Important for tracking new work intake and activity levels.
Items updated today across all statuses and assignees. Recent activity, current work, and active items. Essential for tracking team activity and progress.
Items with due dates across all statuses and assignees. Deadline tracking, time-sensitive work, and schedule management. Critical for project timeline management.
Bugs by component across all statuses. Component-specific defects, area-focused quality tracking, and module issues. Essential for code ownership and maintenance.
Planned work by component across all types. Component-specific backlog, area planning, and module development. Important for component ownership and planning.
Sprint items across all statuses and assignees. Sprint planning, iteration tracking, and agile delivery. Essential for scrum management and sprint monitoring.
Completed sprint items across all types. Sprint delivery, iteration completion, and velocity tracking. Critical for agile metrics and team performance.
Labeled items across all statuses and types. Tagged work, categorized items, and special classifications. Important for filtering and organization.
Resolved items by resolution type across all types and assignees. Resolution patterns, completion methods, and closure tracking. Essential for understanding work outcomes.
Fixed bugs across all assignees. Successfully resolved defects, completed bug fixes, and quality improvements. Important for bug resolution tracking.
Items marked as won't fix across all types and assignees. Declined work, scope changes, and priority decisions. Important for understanding work rejection patterns.
Active work by project across all assignees. Project-specific progress, cross-project visibility, and resource allocation. Essential for portfolio management.
Bugs by project across all statuses. Project-specific quality tracking, defect distribution, and quality metrics. Critical for project health monitoring.
Items with watchers across all statuses and types. Stakeholder interest, visibility tracking, and notification management. Important for communication and stakeholder engagement.
Voted items across all statuses and types. Community interest, popular requests, and user feedback. Important for prioritization and user engagement.
Bugs by environment across all statuses. Environment-specific issues, deployment problems, and infrastructure defects. Essential for environment health monitoring.
Estimated work items across all statuses and assignees. Time tracking, effort planning, and capacity management. Important for project planning and resource allocation.
Completed work with time logged across all assignees. Time tracking, effort analysis, and productivity metrics. Essential for project accounting and estimation improvement.
Reopened items across all types and assignees. Regression issues, incomplete work, and quality escapes. Critical for understanding work quality and process gaps.
Closed items by resolution across all types. Final work states, completion tracking, and closure analysis. Important for understanding work outcomes and patterns.
Sub-tasks across all statuses and assignees. Detailed work breakdown, task decomposition, and granular tracking. Essential for detailed project management.
Child items with parents across all statuses and types. Hierarchical work tracking, epic-story relationships, and work decomposition. Important for understanding work structure.
Bugs by affected version across all statuses. Version-specific defects, regression tracking, and quality by release. Critical for version quality assessment.
Security-related items across all statuses and types. Security issues, vulnerability tracking, and compliance work. Essential for security management and compliance.
Items being tested across all types and assignees. QA validation, testing pipeline, and quality verification. Essential for release readiness and quality gates.
Deployment-ready items across all types and assignees. Release candidates, tested features, and deployment queue. Critical for release coordination and deployment planning.
